bibl.title: Letter from Michael E. Connor to Henry Rose Carter, May 12, 1922

div1.p: Connor asks for Carter's opinion regarding some notes he has compiled on yellow fever. The campaign in Mexico is going well.

div1.head: Letter from Michael E. Connor to Henry Rose Carter, May 12, 1922
div1.opener:
I. H. B.
Connor
PODER EJECUTIVO FEDERAL
MEXICO
ESTADOS UNIDOS MEXICANOS
DEPARTAMENTO
DE
SALUBRIDAD PUBLICA DE MEXICO
----
JEPATURA DE LA CAMPAÑA CONTRA LA FIEBRE
AMARILLA EN LA ZONA DE TAMPICO
APARTADO 1170
RIVERA 16
Tampico, Tamps., May 12, 1922.
My dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
Attached you will find a few notes deal-
ing principally with the value of Stegomyia indices in
Yellow Fever work which Doctor Monroe and myself have
compiled and I have been wondering if you will do me
the favor to look these notes over and let me have your
opinion of same.

I had thought that in the event the arti-
cle seems worth while to you, we would ask permission
of Doctor White and our Board to publish same, say in
the official Mexican Medical Journal.

You have probably seen Dr. White who went
north recently and he has given you the latest informa-
tion regarding the campaign in Mexico which continues
favorably.

With continued good wishes to Miss Laura
and the kindest personal regards, I am,
div1.closer:
Siempre su amigo, M E Connor. To Dr. H. R. Carter,
2121 California St., N. W.
Washington, D. C.
